Title: EM - Elections - Assign Non-Election-Template Offices - Wireframe

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite:\n- Have an existing Election
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Search Election\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Search page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Choose an existing Election and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Check to make sure the UI looks good on multiple screen sizes and different browsers
Test Steps.Step Expected: UI looks and works as expected

Title: EM - Elections - Assign Non-Election-Template Offices - Loading

Test Steps.Step Action:
Pre-requisites:
- Have an existing Office (e.g. TEST OFFICE)
- Have an existing Election Template with that Office assigned (e.g. TEST TEMPLATE)
- Have an existing Election with that Election Template assigned (e.g. TEST ELECTION)
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Search Election
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Search page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the existing Election (e.g. TEST ELECTION) and click on the "Actions" ellipsis\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Check "Election Date Name" field
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Date Name should be prefilled and show the correct Election Name

Test Steps.Step Action: Check "Election Type" field
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Type should be prefilled and show the correct Election Type

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Office Type" dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: A different list of options will display depending on the type of user that is logged into the system (Right now there is only one user type and this will show COUNTY and MUNICIPAL)

Test Steps.Step Action: Select an Office Type
Test Steps.Step Expected: Office Type selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Check the "Office Details"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A list of Offices will be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Check the list of Offices
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Offices that are not assigned to the Template that the Election uses will be displayed (e.g. Since this is the TEST ELECTION and it uses the TEST TEMPLATE, the TEST OFFICE will not be shown in this list)

Test Steps.Step Action: Select any Office from the list and click on the arrow pointing to the right
Test Steps.Step Expected: The chosen Office will now be moved to the "Offices Assigned to the Election" list

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Save"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and you are taken back to the Election Search page

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the Election you just assigned an Office to (e.g. TEST ELECTION) and click on the "Actions" ellipsis\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Check the "Offices Assigned to the Election" list
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Office you just assigned will be displayed here

Title: EM - Elections - Assign Non-Election-Template Offices - Saving

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisites:\n- Have existing Offices\n- Have an existing Election
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Search Election \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Search page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Choose an Election and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Select an Office Type
Test Steps.Step Expected: Office Type selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Select any Office from the "Office Details" list and click on the arrow pointing to the right\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The chosen Office will now be moved to the "Offices Assigned to the Election" list\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Save"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and you are taken back to the Election Search page\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the Election you just assigned an Office to and click on the "Actions" ellipsis\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Check the "Offices Assigned to the Election" list\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Office you just assigned will be displayed here\n

Title: 77533 - EM - Elections - Delete Election

Test Steps.Step Action:
Pre-requisites:
1. Have an existing Election that is not assigned to any Candidates
2. Have an existing Election that is assigned to a candidate
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Elections > Search Election\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Search page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the Election that is not assigned to any Candidates and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Delete"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: A pop-up box will be displayed asking the user if they are sure they want to delete the Election\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Cancel"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The pop-up box will be removed and nothing will happen\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis again\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Delete"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: A pop-up box will be displayed asking the user if they are sure they want to delete the Election\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Ok"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and the Election will be removed from the system\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the existing Election that is assigned to a Candidate and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Delete"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: A pop-up box will be displayed asking the user if they are sure they want to delete the Election\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Ok"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: A notification saying "Election cannot be deleted" will display and the Election will still exist in the system\n

Title: 68911 - EM - Elections Search - Add Election Status column and remove 3 uneeded

Test Steps.Step Action:
Pre-requisites:
- Have an existing Election with the status of "Created"
- Have an existing Election with the status of "Open to Counties"
- Have an existing Election with the status of "Post-election"
- Have an existing Election with the status of "Archived"
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Elections > Search Election\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Search page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Check the page
Test Steps.Step Expected:
The following results columns will be displayed:
- Actions
- Election Name
- Election Date
- Type
- Election Status
- Election ID

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the existing Election with the status of "Created" and ensure all the right information is displayed in the columns
Test Steps.Step Expected: All information is displayed correctly

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the existing Election with the status of "Open to Counties" and ensure all the right information is displayed in the columns\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: All information is displayed correctly\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the existing Election with the status of "Post-election" and ensure all the right information is displayed in the columns\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: All information is displayed correctly\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the existing Election with the status of "Archived" and ensure all the right information is displayed in the columns\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: All information is displayed correctly\n

Test Steps.Step Action: In the search area at the top of the page click on the "Election Status" dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options listed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "Created" and click "Search"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only Elections with the Status of "Created" will be listed

Test Steps.Step Action: Repeat for all over Status types
Test Steps.Step Expected: All Election Status options work as expected and display the correct Elections when searched for

Title: 79660-EM - Election Template - Copy and Save Functionality

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to EM-Elections-Search Election Template
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search Election Template Page must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a template and click on Actions-"Copy and Save"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Maintain Election Template Page must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Edit the template name, office selections and click on "Save"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Template must be saved successfully

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the added new template appears in the Search Election Template page
Test Steps.Step Expected: Added template must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action:
Validate any updates made to the copied template are reflected in the 
 original Template
Test Steps.Step Expected: Original template must remain unchanged\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify if correct  error message is displayed when a user tries to save a template without updating its name.\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: "Election Template already exists " error must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Edit offices and click on  "Cancel"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Updates to election template should not be saved  and the user must be  navigated to the "Election Template Search" Page\n

Title: 79634 - EM - Elections - Election Template Search - Implement partial search and wildcard

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite:\n- Have an existing Election Template
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Elections > Search Election Template\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Template Search page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter the first few characters of the existing Election Template name followed by "%" (e.g. TH%)
Test Steps.Step Expected: Data entered

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Election Templates beginning with those first few characters entered will displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Reset"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter "%" followed by the last few characters of the existing Election Template name (e.g. TE%)\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Data entered\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Election Templates ending with those last few characters entered will displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Reset"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared\n

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter "%" and then any few characters of the existing Election Template name followed by another "%" (e.g. %EC%)\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Data entered\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Election Templates with those few characters entered (in that order) will be displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Reset"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared\n

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter the first few characters of the existing Election Template name followed by "%" and then any few characters that the name contains, followed by another "%" (e.g. T%PL%)\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Data entered\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Election Templates that begin with those characters and contain those characters entered will be displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Reset"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared\n

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter "%" and then any few characters of the existing Election Template name followed by another "%" and then the last few characters of the Election Name (e.g. %CT%E)\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Data entered\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Election Templates that finish with those characters and contain those characters entered will be displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown\n

Title: Verify button label change from "Assign Non-Election-Template Office" to "Manage Election Offices."

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Search Elections page and click Action button for the sear results appeared.
Test Steps.Step Expected: Button label should be "Manage Election Offices."

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Election Search screen
Test Steps.Step Expected: Tree structure interface should be displayed.\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Home > Search Elections screen
Test Steps.Step Expected: Tree should list all available offices associated with the election template.\n

Title: Select an office in the tree structure.

Test Steps.Step Action: Home > Search Election screen
Test Steps.Step Expected: Selected office should remain checked and checked offices must be displayed in the Offices Assigned to the Election section.\n

Title: Deselect an office in the tree structure.

Test Steps.Step Action: Home > Search Election
Test Steps.Step Expected: Deselected office should not be checked and must not be displayed in the "Offices Assigned to the Election" section.\n

Title: Verify that changes (selection/deselection) are saved.

Test Steps.Step Action: Home > Search Election page
Test Steps.Step Expected: Selected offices should persist after saving changes.\n

Title: Open "View Offices" pop-up window

Test Steps.Step Action: Home > Search Election Template page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "Office Details" window should open successfully upon clicking the "View Offices" button.\n

Title: Verify Sorting Functionality in Grid on Office Details page

Test Steps.Step Action: Home > Election Template Search page
Test Steps.Step Expected: Each column in the "Office Details" grid should be sortable, and clicking the sort icon should arrange the data correctly.\n

Title: 69253-Validate Overlapping Polling Dates Multiple Entries

Test Steps.Step Expected: \n\n

Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Expected: Maintain Polling Places Dates & Timings page must be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Add a Polling Availability Dates,Open Time and Close Time and\nHit "Save"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Polling date and time must be added successfully

Test Steps.Step Action: Repeat and add the same Polling Availability Dates with same timings
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.“Error: Overlapping days detected. Please adjust.” message must be displayed\n2.Must not be saved in the System\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Repeat and add the same Polling Availability Date with different timings
Test Steps.Step Expected: Must be saved in the System successfully

Title: EM - Elections - Election Calendar End-to-End Scenario

Test Steps.Step Action: EM - Elections - Election Calendar - Manage Election Dates
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nNavigate to EM -> Elections -> Election Calendar
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nElection Calendar page loads successfully with available events\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \n1. Enter election date name from dropdown list.  2. Select an event from the dropdown list 3. Click ADD NEW choose a date from the date picker. Click on ADD EVENT and select event from the dropdown list and choose a date picker and click SAVE\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nNew Election Calendar Event is successfully added and displayed in the list\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \n1. Modify an existing event date2. Click 'Save'\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nChanges are saved, and the updated event persists in the system\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \n1. Modify an event date2. Click 'Cancel'\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nChanges are discarded, and the previous values remain unchanged\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \n1. Select an event from the list2. Click 'Delete'3. Confirm deletion\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nThe event is removed from the list and the database\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \n1. Access an existing election2. Navigate to Election Calendar3. Add, modify, or delete an event4. Click 'Save' \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nAll updates are saved and persisted correctly\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \n1. Log out and log back in2. Navigate to Election Calendar3. Verify if saved events and modifications are still available\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nAll saved events and modifications persist in the system\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \n1. Attempt to save an event without selecting a date2. Attempt to save duplicate events\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nSystem displays appropriate validation messages and prevents invalid actions\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nVerify the UI components (Dropdown, Date Picker, Save, Delete, cancel buttons) are working as expected\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nAll UI elements function correctly and align with usability standards\n

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. Navigate to Copy Election Calendar section2. Select Election Date Name and Election Type3. Choose a Previous Election Calendar4. Verify displayed event details (Event Code, Name, Event Date)5. Select the Election Calendar to Copy To6. Confirm copy operation
Test Steps.Step Expected: The selected Election Calendar events are successfully copied to the new Election Calendar

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. Navigate to Import File section2. Select Election Date Name3. Select Event4. Click 'Import File'
Test Steps.Step Expected: The selected file is successfully imported, and the event details are updated accordingly

Title: 69145-EM - Elections - Election Calendar - Save / Cancel Event changes

Test Steps.Step Action: PreCondition :User must have appropriate authorization to modify Election Calendar Event
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to the EM - Elections - Election Calendar
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Election Calendar page is displayed with existing events.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Add event fill the requried fields
Test Steps.Step Expected: The changes are reflected on the UI but not yet saved.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the "Save" button.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The modifications are successfully saved. A confirmation message appears.

Test Steps.Step Action: Refresh or reload the page.
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nThe saved changes should still be present\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Modify an event
Test Steps.Step Expected: The changes appear in the UI but are not saved yet.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the "Cancel" button.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The modifications are discarded, and the event reverts to the last saved state.

Test Steps.Step Action: Refresh or reload the page.\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The event details should reflect the last successfully saved state.

Title: 69145-EM - Elections - Election Calendar - Save / Cancel Event changes
73039 - EM - Elections - Election Calendar - Manage Dates - Delete an existing Event Election from the Calendar

Test Steps.Step Action: Launch System
Test Steps.Step Expected: IA System is Opened

Test Steps.Step Action: Login into the system
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is logged in

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate Elections Management > Elections
Test Steps.Step Expected: Elections page is opened

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Election Calendar Button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Calendar is opened

Test Steps.Step Action: On the Elections Date Name Dropdown Select the corresponding Election
Test Steps.Step Expected: Calendar Display the dates filled for this election

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Add New Button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Calendar Manage Date page is opened

Test Steps.Step Action: Confirm a list of dates filled previously is displayed
Test Steps.Step Expected: Each date row has the Trash Icon preceding the Select Event Dropdown

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Trash Icon next to the Date that should be deleted
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Date row is removed from the Screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Press Save Button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Calendar Page is opened

Test Steps.Step Action: On the Elections Date Name Dropdown Select the corresponding Election
Test Steps.Step Expected: Corresponding Calendar is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate through the calendar looking for deleted date
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Date was Deleted

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Add New Button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Election Calendar Manage Date page is opened

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Add Event
Test Steps.Step Expected: New Row is added

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Select Event Dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: Event Removed is now available for adding

Title: 71927 - EM - Funds - HAVA Grants - Add Line Item

Test Steps.Step Action: Preconditions: Logged as Region
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Funds
Test Steps.Step Expected: Add Line Item button is present

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Add Line Item button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Pay Date, Invoice Number, Purpose Area, Budget Category, Units, Match Amount, Federal Amount, Total Amount, Description, Upload Document Fields are present

Test Steps.Step Action: Select Pay Date Field
Test Steps.Step Expected: Calendar item is present and  date could be selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Select Invoice Number
Test Steps.Step Expected: Free text data could be entered

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Purpose Area dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected:
List of following items is displayed
Voting Equipment
Elections Auditing
Voter Registration Systems
Cyber Security
Communication

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Budget Category dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected:
List of following items is displayed
Personnel (including fringe)
Equipment
Training
Other (e.g. contractual supplies)

Test Steps.Step Action: Select Units Field
Test Steps.Step Expected: Allow enter only numeric values

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter Match Amount
Test Steps.Step Expected: Match Amount field allow only numeric values

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter Federal Amount
Test Steps.Step Expected: Federal Amount Field allow only numeric values

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Total Amount Field
Test Steps.Step Expected: Field is read only and display the sum of Match Amount and Federal Amount

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter Description
Test Steps.Step Expected: Text is allowed

Test Steps.Step Action: Press Save Button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Alert Message is displayed because Upload Document is required

Test Steps.Step Action: Upload a Document with document type different of .pdf file
Test Steps.Step Expected: Alert Message is displayed because System only allows pdf files

Test Steps.Step Action: Upload a PDF Document
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Press Save Button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Successfully message is displayed\nLine item is added in to the summary view

Test Steps.Step Action: Look the Summary View
Test Steps.Step Expected: Confirm Line Item added before is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Add Line Item button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Pay Date, Invoice Number, Purpose Area, Budget Category, Units, Match Amount, Federal Amount, Total Amount, Description, Upload Document Fields are present

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill all the mandatory Fields
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Press Save Button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Successfully message is displayed\nLine item is added in to the summary view

Test Steps.Step Action: Look the Summary View
Test Steps.Step Expected: Confirm both Line Items are displayed

Title: 67822 - EM - Manage Election Contests - Configure Election Contests - Contest Details Save

Test Steps.Step Action: \nNavigate to Election Search page from the Election component under the EM Module \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nThe system displays the Election Search page\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nSearch for an election by entering valid criteria and clicking Search\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nThe system displays matching election results\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nFrom the search results, select an election and open the Action Menu\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nThe system displays the available actions for the selected election\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nClick on Manage Election Contests\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nThe system navigates to the Manage Election Contests page\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nClick on Configure Election Contests for the selected contest\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nThe system navigates to the Configure Election Contests page\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nUpdate or enter contest details (e.g., Contest Name, Contest Type, District, etc)\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nThe system allows input in all editable fields\n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nClick the Save button\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nThe system successfully saves the contest details\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify that the system navigates back to the Configure Election Contests main page
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n\nThe user is redirected to the main Configure Election Contests page

Title: 68829 - EM - Elections - Add/Maintain Measures - Change "Ballot Measure Status Reason" to freeform text

Test Steps.Step Action: \nPreconditions:User has the necessary permissions to manage ballot measures.At least one election exists in the system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nNavigate to the Public measures page.\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system navigates to the Public Measures page

Test Steps.Step Action: Click Add to create a new measure
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system opens the Add Measure form

Test Steps.Step Action: Locate the Ballot Measure Status Reason field
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays a text input field

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify that the field is a free-form text box instead of a dropdown list
Test Steps.Step Expected: The field allows unrestricted text input

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter any free-form text (e.g., "Pending approval from election board")
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system accepts the text without restrictions

Test Steps.Step Action: Click Save
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system successfully saves the measure details

Test Steps.Step Action: Reopen the measure and verify that the entered text remains unchanged
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system retains the free-form text input

Title: 69362 - EM - Manage Election Contests - Configure Election Contests - Contest Details Rotation

Test Steps.Step Action: Preconditions:At least one election exists in the system.At least one contest is created under the election.
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to the Election Management module
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the Election Management dashboard

Test Steps.Step Action: Click Search Elections and select the desired election
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the selected election details

Test Steps.Step Action: From the Action Menu, select Manage Election Contests
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system navigates to the Manage Election Contests page

Test Steps.Step Action: Click Configure Election Contests
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the list of contests for the selected election

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a contest and open the Contest Details page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the contest details form

Test Steps.Step Action: Locate the Rotation Algorithm dropdown field
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the available rotation options

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify that the default selection is set to None
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system should display None as the default value

Test Steps.Step Action: Select By Precinct from the dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system updates the selection without errors

Test Steps.Step Action: Click Save
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system successfully saves the changes

Test Steps.Step Action: Reopen the contest and verify that the By Precinct selection is retained
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the saved selection

Test Steps.Step Action: Repeat steps 8-10 for Within Party by Precinct to confirm that all rotation options can be selected and saved
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system allows selection and saves correctly

Title: 69364 - EM - Manage Election Contests - Configure Election Contests - Contest Details Sort Order

Test Steps.Step Action: Preconditions:
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nAt least one election exists in the system.At least one contest is created under the election\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: \nNavigate to the Election Management module\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the Election Management dashboard

Test Steps.Step Action: Click Search Elections and select the desired election
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the selected election details

Test Steps.Step Action: From the Action Menu, select Manage Election Contests
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system navigates to the Manage Election Contests page

Test Steps.Step Action: Click Configure Election Contests
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the list of contests for the selected election

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a contest and open the Contest Details page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the contest details form

Test Steps.Step Action: \nLocate the Sort Order field\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays a field for entering a numerical sort order value

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter a valid Sort Order # (e.g., 1, 2, 3)
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system accepts the entered value

Test Steps.Step Expected: The contest appears in the correct position based on the new sort order.

Title: 69420 - EM - Manage Election Contests - Configure Election Contests - Clear Search Results

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Manage Election Contests page \n 2. Check if the Reset button is visible next to the search fields
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Reset button should be available and easily accessible

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter search parameters \n 2. Click on Reset
Test Steps.Step Expected: All entered search fields should be cleared

Test Steps.Step Action: Perform a search with valid parameters \n 2. Verify results are displayed \n 3. Click on Reset
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search results grid should be cleared, displaying no records

Test Steps.Step Expected: The system should return new results based on the latest search criteria

Title: 71853 - EM - Manage Election Contests - Add 'Add Contest' nav element

Test Steps.Step Action: \nPreconditions:The user must be logged in with appropriate permissions to manage election contests.An election must be created and accessible in the system.The Manage Contests page must be available with an active contest.\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to the Manage Election Contests page from the Election Search menu
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Manage Election Contests page should load successfully

Test Steps.Step Action: Look for a navigation element labeled "Add Office" on the Manage Election Contests page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "Add Office" button should be visible

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Add Office" button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system should navigate the user to the Manage Election Offices page

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify that the Manage Election Offices page loads correctly with available election offices
Test Steps.Step Expected: The page should display the list of available election offices

Test Steps.Step Action: Attempt to add a new office from the Manage Election Offices page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system should allow the user to add an office successfully

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate back to the Manage Election Contests page and confirm that the newly added office is available for selection
Test Steps.Step Expected: The newly added office should appear as an option in contest creation

Title: 73205 - EM - Manage Election Contests - Configure Election Contests - Contest Details Cancel

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. Navigate to Manage Election Contests from the Election Search menu. \n 2. Select a contest and open the Contest Details page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Contest Details page should load successfully

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. Make changes to any editable fields on the Contest Details page. \n 2. Do NOT click Save
Test Steps.Step Expected: Changes should appear on the screen but remain unsaved

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the Cancel button. \n 2. Confirm cancellation if a confirmation prompt appears
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system should discard all unsaved changes and return the user to the Configure Election Contests page

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. Navigate back to the same contest's Contest Details page. \n 2. Check if the changes made before clicking Cancel were discarded
Test Steps.Step Expected: All previously unsaved changes should be discarded, and only the last saved values should be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: After clicking Cancel, verify that the user is redirected back to the Configure Election Contests page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Configure Election Contests page should load correctly, displaying the list of contests

Title: EM - Election - Manage Election Precincts - Save/ Cancel

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to the "Manage Election Precincts" page.\n 2. In the "Search Elections" section, select an "Election Date Name".\n 3. Choose the "Election Type"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The election is displayed in the search results, based on the selected "Election Date Name" and "Election Type"

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. Select "District Type" from the search filter options.\n 2. Choose "All" or a specific district type (e.g., "SENATE DISTRICT 15")
Test Steps.Step Expected: The district list filters to show only the selected district type

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. Select a district (e.g., "SENATE DISTRICT 15").\n 2. Click "Precincts in This District"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The available precincts are displayed, showing the precinct names and counts (e.g., "Precincts Available: 0")

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. From the district precinct list, select desired precincts (e.g., "BOONE 01", "DEN STREET-1/2", "DEN STREET-2/2")
Test Steps.Step Expected: The selected precincts are listed under "Included Election Precincts" with the selected count

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. After selecting precincts, verify the displayed count of selected precincts
Test Steps.Step Expected: The count of selected precincts is displayed correctly

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. After selecting the precincts, click "SAVE".\n 2. Confirm that the action completes successfully and precincts are saved
Test Steps.Step Expected: The selected precincts are saved and no errors are encountered

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. After selecting the precincts, click "CANCEL".\n 2. Confirm that the action cancels the selection and returns to the previous screen without saving changes
Test Steps.Step Expected: The selected precincts are not saved, and the system returns to the previous page without making changes

Test Steps.Step Action: 1. Navigate to the selected district\n 2. Verify the selected precincts appear under the "Precincts in This District" section.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The selected precincts are displayed correctly under the district.
